intro: Orthogynium gomphloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf orthogynium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, pinnate structure. The flowers are small and white, contributing to its ecological role as a nectar source for pollinators.
